snippet: Unless the cause of the Heathrow fire is pinpointed quickly, the airline industry could once again find itself in a delicate spot of balancing passenger safety with high financial stakes.
abstract: Airlines and investors express confidence in Boeing's troubled 787 Dreamliner despite unexplained fire on parked model at Heathrow Airport in London; if cause of fire is not soon determined, airline industry could once again find itself in delicate position of balancing passenger safety with high financial stakes.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW and JAD MOUAWAD
byline.contributor: Natasha Singer, Georgi Kantchev and Stephen Castle contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Unless the cause of the Heathrow fire is pinpointed quickly, the airline industry could once again find itself in a delicate spot of balancing passenger safety with high financial stakes.

headline.main: Airlines Confident in Boeing’s 787, but Doubts Linger
headline.print_headline: Airlines Confident In Boeing’s 787, But Doubts Linger
